name: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust
description: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust, commonly known as SPY, is one of the largest and most well-known exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in the world. Launched in 1993, it aims to provide investors with exposure to the performance of the S&P 500 Index, which comprises 500 of the largest publicly traded companies in the United States. SPY is designed to track the total return of the S&P 500, making it a popular choice for both institutional and retail investors looking for a simple and effective way to invest in the U.S. equity market. The fund is managed by State Street Global Advisors and has a reputation for high liquidity, which allows investors to buy and sell shares with ease. SPY is particularly favored for its transparency, as it discloses its holdings on a daily basis, and its low expense ratio compared to actively managed funds. Additionally, SPY offers dividends that are paid quarterly, providing a source of income for investors. The ETF has become a staple in many investment portfolios, serving as a core holding for diversification and risk management. With its long-standing history and robust trading volume, SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust remains a key player in the financial markets, enabling investors to participate in the growth of the U.S. economy.

key_executives.name: James M. Ross
key_executives.position: Head of Global ETF Capital Markets

seo.meta_title: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) | Invest in the S&P 500
seo.meta_description: Invest in the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) to gain exposure to the performance of the S&P 500 Index, featuring 500 of the largest U.S. companies.

faq.question: What is the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust?
faq.answer: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust is an exchange-traded fund that aims to track the performance of the S&P 500 Index.

faq.question: Who manages the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust?
faq.answer: The fund is managed by State Street Global Advisors.

faq.question: How can I invest in SPY?
faq.answer: You can invest in SPY through any brokerage account that offers trading in exchange-traded funds.

faq.question: What is the expense ratio of SPY?
faq.answer: SPY has a low expense ratio, which makes it cost-effective for investors.

faq.question: When are dividends paid for SPY?
faq.answer: Dividends for SPY are paid quarterly.
